It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often in rocky or humus-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
